Rafael Hernández

Happy to have football and Messi back! A goal and two great assists and he's already hit the ground running in the first return match that felt more like a deluxe friendly. Mallorca are fighting relegation and they also were toothless for most of the match, but that doesn't change the fact that Barcelona needed to grab all three points. Tougher or easier, all of them count.

I will refrain from criticizing or praising the players for tonight, let's leave that for at least 3-4 matches post quarantine.

The three months off have benefited the team greatly. Messi managed to properly rest after dragging annoying minor injuries for half of the season, and many of the squad were injured or getting injured if the season had continued normally.

Barcelona have tougher away matches than Real Madrid, but empty stadiums removes the biggest obstacle for these contests. And the Camp Nou is quiet for most of the time anyway, doesn't make a difference for home matches, the main advantage does: bigger pitch!

Barcelona players were said to be performing much better in training compared to actual matches. Empty stadiums means no pressure, this could bizarrely help the team.

Don’t forget to send messages to Arthur on social media after the match, reminding him that the board leaves next year and he needs to stay at the club at all costs!

https://www.facebook.com/Lasenyera.en/posts/2916277131828860
FC Barcelona's management is not the only reason for our downfall. Players are equally responsible for the massacre that's about to happen. Here's why.

Bayern Munich, Juventus, Chelsea, Real Madrid, Manchester United and other big clubs are building squads which can compete for another decade on top level. All these clubs and their management have one thing in common. Get to the top no matter what. Even Juventus, a team that barely spends are going all out and targeting top notch players like Arthur, Tonali and Jorginho, while trying to outwit the sellers.

Meanwhile, there is FC Barcelona, which is nothing but a retirement home for players who are 30+. Finished, passionless, amigos who only care about their paychecks and whine about fans setting unrealistic expectations. If Arthur agrees to leave, de Jong will be the only first team player in the midfield who is not 30 or above. If there is one thing I despise about Messi or any senior player, it's that they are all comfortable with their lives and won't stand up to the corrupt management regardless of the wrong doings. I mean, why would they sacrifice their position in the team to someone better. They'd rather let the board make stupid decisions and let the fans vent their anger out on these clowns. At the end of the day, they get their agreed sum of money and we cry about not succeeding.

Rakitic in a recent interview said, "I am not a sack of potatoes" that Barcelona can do whatever they want with, and stressed his desire to finish the contract he has with the club, which runs until 2021. Is this what our club has come to? That an average player, who is past his prime has decided to play out his contract and not retrospect whether or not he can contribute anymore? Legends like Xavi and Iniesta decided to leave once they felt that their contributions are not needed anymore and that young players deserve a chance. How I wish they were right.

Johan Cryuff gave us an ideology of "Total Football" which was being successfully carried forward for years by different managements. Ever since this incompetent board took over, they have been shitting all over the legacy he built by buying players who never fit the system but has the "Big Name". It's not just about Arthur. I really would not have been bothered about selling Arthur if we had a better replacement, or even a player with high potential like Fabian Ruiz or Sandro Tonali or even Tanguy Ndombele ffs. It's just that, we are giving up on a player who has everything required to succeed in a club like Barça, just to cover up the mismanagement of the clowns in the heirarchy. Exchanging him for the likes of Pjanic is just insulting on many levels.

Y'all can axe me for my opinion, but truth be told, FC Barcelona is done for atleast half a decade, regardless of whether we win UCL this season. Even if Bartomeu fails in the next election and Victor Font or Laporta wins, I really can't see how we can compete on an elite level for the next 5 years, considering Messi is approaching the end of his peak and we haven't really done anything about it and also the mess that Bartomeu will be leaving. This is the sad bitter truth. There's no escape from this. We have truly transitioned from the greatest team ever, to a bunch of players who's counter attacks can't even reach half the pitch.

Welcome to the "Club de Amigos". Where if the seniors approve of you, you can stay no matter how shitty of a player you are.

搵人開post

Victor Font, a pre-candidate for the presidency of FC Barcelona in the 2021 elections, revealed the keys to his project in an interview on the INSIDE Sport Business podcast of Sports & Life. "We are quite clear that if there is no project similar to ours, we risk becoming a new Milan, a club with many titles that no longer competes, we put the priority model at risk”, explained the Catalan businessman.

In Font's opinion, Barça needs "a change of model" and is committed to "creativity" so as not to risk the club no longer belonging to its members. "Today the ultimate decision rests with the managers, who are still passionate partners who have five years of seniority and money to endorse”, said the candidate.

In his goal of making the club a world reference again, Víctor Font specified that “he is looking for profiles of directors with real experience to lead the club. People who come from the world of sports, people who come from the world of business, technology, audiovisual content, electronic commerce, where a club like Barça must generate resources, and people with weight in the institutional area”, appreciated the pre-candidate for the presidency of Barça.

Finally, Víctor Font was selected as a supporter of rethinking the ‘Espai Barça’. "It was voted in 2014, we were told it would cost 600 million and now this is going up. We ask that no decision be made in these months because it can mortgage the future”, added the businessman. [MD]
